subclusters.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on thymic involution, naive T cell decline, memory T cell accumulation, and immune-risk phenotype driving systemic aging and autoimmunity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes thymic involution, T cell repertoire shrinkage, memory T cell accumulation, and inflammaging as core immunosenescence mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes thymic involution, adaptive immune decline, senescent cell accumulation, and inflamm-aging as drivers of immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details thymic involution, naive T cell depletion, immune memory decline, and chronic infections accelerating immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chronic antigenic stress causing CD8+ T cell exhaustion, accumulation of antigen-experienced T cells, and immune remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights T cell functional changes, naive T cell decline, memory T cell accumulation, NF-κB activation, and inflammaging in immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes lifelong antigenic load driving immune remodeling, naive T cell reduction, memory T cell accumulation, and inflamm-aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Remodeling Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers immunosenescence with adaptive immune changes, inflammaging, SASP, and immune risk phenotype linked to thymic involution.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence and Inflammaging Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immunosenescence and inflammaging as interconnected remodeling processes shaped by immunobiography and chronic immune activation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence and Inflammaging Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes immunosenescence, inflammaging, SASP, and myeloid skewing as components of immune remodeling in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence and Inflammaging Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents immunosenescence and inflammaging as adaptive remodeling processes influenced by immunobiography and senescent immune cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence and Inflammaging Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mutual reinforcement of immunosenescence and inflamm-aging, adaptive vs innate immune changes, and chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence and Inflammaging Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links longevity assurance genes to immune balance, pro- and anti-inflammatory phenotypes, and immunological risk phenotype in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine-Thymus Functional Unity Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes functional unity of thymus and pineal gland, their joint involution, melatonin decline, and neuroendocrine regulation of immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine-Thymus Functional Unity Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on thymus involution as aging pacemaker regulated by neuroendocrine signals including pineal gland, linking immune and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome-Driven Immunological Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes NLRP3 inflammasome's dual role, age-related tipping point, and chronic inflammation driving age-associated diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome-Driven Immunological Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights NLRP3 as central innate immunity regulator, chronic activation causing inflammaging, and genetic links to healthy aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome-Driven Immunological Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on NLRP3 sensing age-related DAMPs, caspase-1 activation, IL-1 cytokine release, and multi-organ aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome-Driven Immunological Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates senoinflammation concept with NLRP3 inflammasome, SASP, NF-κB signaling, and chronic unresolved inflammation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes chronic inflammation driving aging, hepatic senescence, fibrosis, and NF-κB mediated proinflammatory gene expression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links chronic low-grade inflammation and para-inflammation to cancer initiation and progression via NF-κB and inflammatory microenvironment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes systemic inflammation from infections as causal driver of dementia via vascular and blood-brain barrier disruption.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes early-life immune activation causing persistent immunopathological damage and inflammation accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on inflammation-driven dysregulation of osteoimmunology axis, myeloid skewing, HSC exhaustion, and gut microbiome in obesity-accelerated aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Inflammation and NF-κB Signaling Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links inflammation and oxidative stress to vascular rarefaction and stroke severity in Alzheimer's disease, implicating inflammatory signaling pathways.
